comments:
I'm creating some JUnit tests to test J2EE projects and the return values of the Server/J2EE interface. The tests create a new project and then test various API on it.

I've run the same tests more than 50 times, and it ran ok (well, with expected JUnit failures) all but twice. One time there were a few additional API failures (I'll be opening a second bug), and one time it caused the exceptions below.

As a result of J2EEDeployableFactory failing, none of the projects were recognized by server tools and all of the subsequent tests failed. I am making this critical because if it had happened during regular development it would have caused modules to disappear from servers and general failure throughout WTP.

Created an attachment (id=51654)
Proposed patch

Tim,

Can you try rerunning the tests with the patch applied?  The patch should ensure we never have an empty resource.

Thanks,
I run with the patch and see if I can reproduce, but keep in mind that this was sporatic and not reproducable at will.
Since its intermitten, this should go to 1.5.3.  The surrent proposed fix may not be desireable and could be change in behaviour...
We are also seeing this error sporadically during execution of unit tests (on 1.5.2)

Hit the following failure w/ application of the patch; based on an initial scan, it looks like the EarValidator is causing execution of:

...
public static EObject getRoot(Resource aResource) throws EmptyResourceException {
		EList extent = aResource.getContents();
		if (extent.size() < 1) {
			throw new EmptyResourceException(aResource.getURI().toString());
		}
		return (EObject) extent.get(0);
	}
...

in ArchiveUtil and triggering the EmptyResourceException and an error in this type of case (empty content EList) is exactly what the proposed patch is trying to fix; Chuck, let me know your thoughts here.

...

I don't like this proposed patch because it is just patching the symptom.

multi threaded startup issues seem to be the real issue, as I'm assuming the xml file does indeed have a root object, and failed to load for some other reason.

Rob do you have a testcase we can focus on here?
Sorry, Chuck, nothing specific; we're seeing the error on a very intermittent basis during a large automated unit test (which is exercising all sorts of things).
Ok, until we have more specifics.. I'm going to untarget this defect....
Hoi, cc'ing you since I believe you are encountering this more frequently and can provide some more details/specifics on a use case that is triggering the issue

I am able to reproduce this error consistently when I run one of my application in Eclipse headless mode.  When the same application runs in the Eclipse IDE, the error never appears.  I wonder if there is some initialization that is not done in the headless mode which causes this error.

Here is the errors that I am seeing:

Hi Raj,

Can you take a look at the latest details?

FYI: We have worked around the consistently reproducible case of this error by ensuring that the relevant logic all executes within an IWorkspaceRunnable in headless mode (with resource change events batched, this EMF issue is no longer getting triggered from ServerResourceChangeListener). 

I assume that the other (more sporadic) triggers for this bug still exist, however, it is no longer a blocker for us.
Removing target milestone of 1.5.4 as per David Williams' instructions.

This is a very intermittent bug according to originator. I have not been able to reproduce it at all with the latest builds. I heard from another committer that they were seeing exceptions like these before they fixed bug 191294 and not ever since.

I would like to return this bug as a dup of that especially because the exception trace includes ear validator. Please reopen if you have a reproducible scenario.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 191294 ***

traces.message: IWAE0053E An internal error has occurred running validation on project:DRTEARProject]:DRTEARProject, check the log file for details
